mywebserver

Class MultithreadedServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • mywebserver.MultithreadedServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class MultithreadedServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The Class MultithreadedServer handles multiple client request in a Multithreaded way. It manages the requests with the help of Thread-pooling in Java

        public MultithreadedServer(int serverPort,
                           java.lang.String serverDirectory)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Instantiates a new Multithreaded server.
        Parameters:
        serverPort - is the port which is accepting client requests
        serverDirectory - is the folder where the requested files are present
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred, in case serverSocket fails.

      • processGETRequest

        public HttpResponse processGETRequest(java.lang.String request,
                                      java.lang.String body)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Process GET request. Based on the current implementation, the Request Body of the request send by the Client will be ignored, because this GET request just retrieves the contents of the file specified by the file-path/URL.
        Parameters:
        request - the request
        body - the body
        Returns:
        the my http response
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
